introduction: Association of Friends of Technical Science
explore: Explore our projects and learn more about our mission!

home.headline: Promoting Technical Sciences and Innovation
home.subheading: Empowering the next generation of innovators through education, research, and collaboration
home.aboutText: UPTZ brings together enthusiasts, students, and professionals passionate about technology and its applications. Founded in 2020, we aim to make technical knowledge accessible to everyone.
home.projectsSectionDescription: Innovative Solutions by Our Team Members

subsection1.title: Wilson
subsection1.description: Wilson is an advanced electric racing boat that achieved outstanding success at international competitions this year, securing 4th place in the most demanding endurance race and 2nd place in both slalom and elimination races. The vessel is powered by a robust 20kW electric motor and 10kWh Li-Ion battery pack that enables reaching maximum speeds of 25 knots. The construction is reinforced with carbon tubes, and the cockpit design incorporates elements of the Croatian flag with special emphasis on the red and white checkerboard pattern.

subsection2.title: Malo Vitra
subsection2.description: "Malo vitra" is a prototype racing catamaran developed by students as part of the Adria Energy Boat Class project. It's powered by renewable energy sources, utilizing solar cells to drive an electric motor without CO2 emissions. The vessel features a lightweight yet strong carbon fiber composite construction and achieved a top speed of 11.8 knots, showcasing innovative sustainable technology in maritime mobility.

subsection3.title: Teredo Navalis
subsection3.description: "Teredo Navalis" is a solar-powered boat designed and built by students for the Monaco Energy Boat Challenge. Constructed with a lightweight sandwich of styrofoam, PET, carbon, and glass fibers, it achieves a maximum speed of 16 knots using a 1.5 kWh battery pack and 1300 W solar cells, demonstrating sustainable nautical technology.

hydroContest.name: HydroContest
hydroContest.description: An international student competition focused on energy efficiency in sea transport. Teams design and build radio-controlled vessels powered by renewable energy sources.

monacoEnergyBoatChallenge.name: Monaco Energy Boat Challenge
monacoEnergyBoatChallenge.description: A prestigious event where teams from around the world compete with their energy-efficient boats, showcasing innovation in maritime technology.

adriaHydrofoil.name: Adria Hydrofoil
adriaHydrofoil.description: A regional competition promoting the development of hydrofoil technology in the Adriatic region, encouraging students to innovate in marine engineering.

adriaEnergyBoatClass.name: Adria Energy Boat Class
adriaEnergyBoatClass.description: A competition that challenges students to design and build energy-efficient boats, focusing on renewable energy solutions and sustainable maritime practices.

deltaOne.overview: Delta One is an autonomous underwater vehicle designed for underwater exploration and research. It represents our flagship project in marine robotics.

features.feature3: Real-time data transmission to surface stations

deltaOne.technical: Delta One uses a combination of advanced sensors, custom propulsion systems, and proprietary software for control and navigation. The main hull is constructed from carbon fiber for optimal strength-to-weight ratio.

maloVitra.driveSystemDesc: The propulsion system is based on a mix of currently available sustainable technologies.
maloVitra.overview: Malo Vitra is an educational platform about renewable energy sources, with a focus on wind energy.

features.feature1: Interactive models of small wind turbines
features.feature2: Educational materials tailored for different age groups

maloVitra.technical: The project uses 3D-printed components, low-power microcomputers, and solar cells to demonstrate sustainable energy solutions.

vesselParameters.title: Vessel Parameters
vesselParameters.description: is weight of the cockpit. The total weight of the vessel with all equipment is 246kg.

cockpitConstruction.title: Cockpit Construction
points: Vacuum infusion molding process by Marservis d.o.o. from Kaštelir
Basic laminate: 2 layers of carbon 200 g/m² roving with epoxy resin
Bottom reinforced with Soric XF 135 g/m² sandwich core construction
8 additional layers in cockpit abutment area on carbon tubes
Driver's bulkhead and outer decks with 10mm AIREX T92 PET core
Locally reinforced areas in driver's compartment and battery housing

motorSupport.title: Motor Support
points: Sandwich construction with 25mm thickness for maximum stiffness
PVC core 200 g/m³ with superior structural properties
2 layers of carbon fiber on both inside and outside surfaces
Same carbon fiber grammage as hull for consistency
Bonded to transom using structural adhesive for durability

structuralDesign.title: Structural Design
points: Deck made of 2 layers of carbon fiber with local stiffening
Forward hull and deck bonded with methacrylate-based structural glue
Rear section screwed to aluminum frame with waterproof sealing
Battery and electronics area with specialized joint sealing
Recycled AIREX T92 PET core materials from previous vessels

captions.vessel_overview: Malo Vitra during testing - showcasing the sleek catamaran design
captions.construction_detail: Advanced carbon fiber construction with vacuum infusion process
captions.cockpit_view: Ergonomic cockpit design with integrated control systems

details.title: Project Overview
details.description: Malo Vitra is our team's latest innovative vessel - a prototype racing catamaran powered entirely by renewable energy sources via solar cells, operating without CO2 emissions. The vessel features an advanced electric propulsion system that supplies power to the outboard electric motor, representing a breakthrough in sustainable maritime technology.

details.title: Competition Performance
details.description: In the Adria Energy Boat Class competition, the Rijeka team achieved outstanding results among 13 international teams. They secured 3rd place on the podium in the most demanding endurance race, 5th place in both slalom and elimination races, finishing 4th overall. This represents the best result in the young team's history, demonstrating exceptional performance in sustainable maritime technology.

details.title: Environmental Impact
details.description: Zero-emission propulsion system with regenerative capabilities. Solar panels provide sustainable energy, making it completely environmentally friendly for marine ecosystems.

details.title: Custom Propeller Design
details.description: The propeller was independently designed and manufactured using additive printing technology with a combination of carbon fiber and nylon at 100% filling density. This innovative propulsion component enabled the vessel to achieve its impressive maximum speed of 11.8 knots, demonstrating the effectiveness of advanced 3D printing in marine applications.

details.title: Team Collaboration
details.description: Developed through interdisciplinary collaboration between naval architecture students, electrical engineers, and composite material specialists from University of Rijeka.

details.title: Technical Challenges
details.description: Overcoming complex hydrodynamic challenges, optimizing battery management systems, and integrating solar charging while maintaining competitive weight limits.

details.title: Future Development
details.description: Plans include implementing autonomous navigation systems, advanced energy management algorithms, and exploring hydrogen fuel cell integration for extended range.

details.title: Academic Research Context
details.description: Adria Energy Boat Class is an interdisciplinary research program combining students, academics, and industry professionals to advance sustainable maritime technology. The initiative focuses on renewable energy integration, electric propulsion systems, and energy storage optimization. Through international competitions, the program bridges theoretical research with practical applications in sustainable marine transportation.

teredoNavalis.overview: Teredo Navalis is a system for monitoring and protecting wooden maritime structures from damaging marine organisms.

features.feature1: Sensor systems for early detection of biological threats

teredoNavalis.technical: This project combines advanced vibration detection sensors, waterproof computing systems, and specialized coatings for protecting wooden structures in marine environments.

wilson.overview: Wilson is an autonomous robot designed to assist in forest research and monitoring of forest ecosystems.

features.feature2: Advanced sensors for analyzing flora and fauna
features.feature3: Solar charging for extended field operation

propulsion.description: of E-Propulsion Navy 20 outboard electric motor

vesselParameters.title: Vessel Parameters
vesselParameters.description: is of weight of the cockpit. The total weight of the vessel with all equipment is 120kg without the hulls. Hulls weigh 60kg.

cockpitConstruction.title: Cockpit Construction
points: Closed-type design with battery and electronics in separate compartment
All electronic components housed behind driver's bulkhead for safety
Longitudinal reinforcement with two carbon tubes (50mm outer diameter)
Carbon tube wall thickness of 2mm for optimal strength-to-weight ratio
Croatian flag elements integrated into exterior cockpit design
Red checkerboard pattern emphasizing national identity and pride

motorSupport.title: Engine Mount & Propulsion
points: Carbon fiber sandwich structure for lightweight performance
High strength construction combining advanced composite materials
Waterjet-cut components for precision manufacturing
Prepreg materials molded parts for optimal quality
20kW Edyn 2035 outboard electric motor integration
Hydraulic steering system with steering wheel control

structuralDesign.title: Advanced Manufacturing
points: Vacuum infusion fabrication techniques for superior quality
Oven-cured prepregs ensuring structural integrity
10kWh Li-Ion battery pack with maximum capacity design
Maximum speed capability of 25 knots achievement
Modern and dynamic design reflecting national pride
Advanced composite techniques throughout construction process

details.title: Project Overview
details.description: Wilson is our advanced electric racing boat that represents a breakthrough in sustainable marine technology. With its closed-type cockpit design and integrated Croatian flag elements, it combines performance with national identity. The vessel achieved remarkable success in international competitions, demonstrating the effectiveness of electric propulsion in competitive maritime environments.

details.title: Competition Performance
details.description: This year, the team from Rijeka reached 4th place in the most demanding endurance race, while they achieved 2nd place in the slalom race and the elimination race, which made them get onto the podium in 2nd place. 17 teams from all over the world took part in the competition, and their placement is also the best result of this young team.

details.title: Environmental Impact
details.description: Powered entirely by electric propulsion with Li-Ion battery technology, Wilson operates with zero direct emissions. The vessel demonstrates that high-performance racing can be achieved sustainably, paving the way for cleaner marine transportation technologies.

details.title: Innovation Features
details.description: Wilson incorporates cutting-edge carbon fiber sandwich construction, precision waterjet-cut components, and advanced prepreg materials. The integration of hydraulic steering with electric propulsion represents a significant advancement in marine control systems.

details.title: Cultural Design
details.description: The exterior cockpit design incorporates elements of the Croatian national flag with special emphasis on the red checkerboard pattern. This design reflects national pride and identity through modern and dynamic aesthetics, making Wilson a true ambassador of Croatian engineering excellence.

details.title: Team Collaboration
details.description: Developed through intensive collaboration between naval architecture students, electrical engineers, and composite material specialists. The project brought together expertise from multiple disciplines to create a world-class racing vessel.

details.title: Technical Excellence
details.description: Advanced manufacturing techniques including vacuum infusion and oven-cured prepregs ensure optimal structural integrity. The longitudinal carbon tube reinforcement and specialized battery compartment design represent engineering innovation at its finest.

details.title: Future Development
details.description: Plans include exploring advanced battery management systems, regenerative charging capabilities, and further optimization of the hull design for even better racing performance while maintaining environmental sustainability.

wilson.technical: The robot uses GPS-free navigation systems, highly durable materials, and specialized algorithms for natural pattern recognition.

contact.reachOut: Feel free to reach out with any questions or inquiries. We're here to help!

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to promote technical sciences and innovation through education, research, and collaboration. We aim to make technical knowledge accessible to everyone, regardless of their background.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: We envision a future where technical knowledge is shared freely and openly, enabling individuals and communities to solve problems and create innovative solutions to global challenges.

history.title: Our History
history.description: Founded in 2020, UPTZ began as a small group of enthusiasts with a shared passion for technology and education. Since then, we've grown into a diverse community of students, professionals, and hobbyists working together on exciting projects.

partner1.name: University of Zagreb
partner1.description: Academic collaboration on research projects and student engagement.

partner2.name: Tech Innovation Hub
partner2.description: Joint workshops and innovation challenges focusing on emerging technologies.

partner3.name: Green Energy Initiative
partner3.description: Collaboration on sustainable technology projects and renewable energy solutions.

introduction.title: Our Open Source Philosophy
introduction.description: We believe in the power of open source to drive innovation and collaboration. By sharing our work openly, we contribute to the global community of knowledge and enable others to build upon our foundations.

contribute.title: How to Contribute
contribute.description: We welcome contributions from developers, designers, and anyone interested in our projects. Whether you're fixing a bug, improving documentation, or adding new features, your contributions help make our projects better.
contribute.getInTouch: Interested in contributing but not sure where to start? Get in touch with us!

repo1.name: Project Delta One
repo1.description: Open source code for underwater vehicle control systems and navigation algorithms.

repo2.name: Educational Wind Energy Kit
repo2.description: 3D printing files and software for the Malo Vitra educational platform.

repo3.name: Forest Monitoring Tools
repo3.description: Software and hardware designs for environmental monitoring systems used in Project Wilson.

footer.description: UPTZ brings together enthusiasts, students, and professionals passionate about technology and its applications. We make technical knowledge accessible to everyone.
footer.socialDescription: Stay connected with us on social media for updates and news.
footer.donationDescription: The money raised by donations covers the cost of components for our boat. Even a small gesture is a great help to our team.
footer.donationNote: Your support helps fund our projects and educational initiatives.
